speaker: Valoria, Remembered
lines: You speak the name the city wanted to hear and not be owned by.
Walls relax; arches drop their shoulders.
Banners find their colors and keep them this time.
The fountain laughs without swallowing anyone's wish.
Stalls settle into patient lines as if the market had just agreed to open again.
In the tower, the bell rings once to mark a debt paid in full.
A door opens where no door has been since maps grew tired.
From within, a chest carries itself politely into the square and waits for you to notice.
